HomePage.title: wan-2.5.video
HomePage.description: Everything you need to introduce Wan2.5 to your audience.

hero.title: Wan2.5: cinematic AI video with native audio
hero.description: Turn your prompts into 10-second 1080p stories with lip-synced voices, multilanguage delivery, and confident motion control.

logocloud.title: Featured by creators and partners exploring Wan2.5

specs.title: How creators ship Wan2.5 videos today
specs.description: Follow a repeatable flow to storyboard, refine, and share high-impact clips while the public release gets ready.

step-1.title: Map your story
step-1.description: Outline the hook, characters, and camera pacing in one clear paragraph before you generate anything.
step-1.label: Prompt idea
step-1.example: Example prompt: 'A slow push-in on a neon-lit cafe where a founder previews Wan2.5, rain streaking outside and typography appearing in mid-air.'

step-2.title: Select visuals and sound
step-2.description: Choose aspect ratio, duration, and audio style. Decide whether to keep Wan2.5's native dub or upload your own track.
step-2.label: Scene checklist
step-2.example: Include mood, camera moves, wardrobe, transitions, and call-to-action text so the model understands the beat.

step-3.title: Review and publish
step-3.description: Download the MP4, trim or loop as needed, and repurpose the clip for shorts, product pages, and in-product education.
step-3.label: Share it fast
step-3.example: Export with subtitles for social, keep a watermark version for teasers, and archive credits for compliance.

prompt-lab.title: Prompt lab favorites
prompt-lab.description: Reusable structures that help Wan2.5 deliver cinematic pacing.
bullets: Stack sensory keywords: lighting, texture, camera framing, and pacing cues.
Flag dialogue beats in quotes so the native voice keeps up with lip movements.
List product names and UI text exactly how you want them rendered on screen.

audio-tips.title: Audio finishing tips
audio-tips.description: Decide whether Wan2.5 or your own track should lead the story.
bullets: Keep uploaded MP3 or WAV files between 3 and 30 seconds to match clip length.
Ask for ASMR, ambience, or musical build-ups in the prompt when you let Wan2.5 score it.
Export voiceover-only takes for localization, then remix with platform-specific music.

share.title: Share with stakeholders
share.description: Help teams decide which clips go live first.
bullets: Drop renders into a Notion board or Airtable base with notes on length and CTA.
Tag clips that need reshoots so editors know what to iterate.
Collect reactions from sales, social, and product in one place before launch.

demos.title: Ready-to-run story starters
demos.description: Adjust these prompts, voice notes, and framing ideas to match your brand in minutes.

demo-1.title: Product teaser
demo-1.prompt: Prompt: 'Macro shots of a cobalt smart speaker rotating on a glass pedestal, dynamic typography announcing "Powered by Wan2.5".'
demo-1.note: Pair with bilingual voiceover for launch emails.

demo-2.title: Learning bite
demo-2.prompt: Prompt: 'Warm classroom light over a tablet, teacher guiding students through three animated steps with captions.'
demo-2.note: Use gentle acoustic audio and call-to-action overlays.

demo-3.title: Virtual host intro
demo-3.prompt: Prompt: 'Energetic host in a minimalist studio welcomes viewers to the Wan2.5 community livestream, camera dollying around them.'
demo-3.note: Swap voices for each language version in seconds.

demo-4.title: Travel microfilm
demo-4.prompt: Prompt: 'Golden-hour aerials of Shanghai's skyline transitioning into street-level slow motion with handheld camera moves.'
demo-4.note: Blend ASMR ambience with soft lo-fi beats for reels.

integration.title: Wan2.5 in a snapshot
integration.subtitle: Key highlights for creators
integration.description: Preview what you can expect when Wan2.5 powers your next video drop.

item-1.title: Cinematic detail
item-1.description: Generate 10-second clips in 1080p at 24 fps with stable motion, dynamic lighting, and crisp typography.

item-2.title: Native sound design
item-2.description: Let Wan2.5 craft realistic dialogue, ambience, and music or upload your own track for perfect sync.

item-3.title: Creative control
item-3.description: Direct the scene with camera paths, transitions, and on-screen text while keeping prompt extend available.

item-4.title: Global-ready
item-4.description: Produce multilingual voiceovers and subtitles so each region gets a version that feels native.

features.title: Use cases we see every day
features.subtitle: Bring Wan2.5 into your workflow
features.description: Select a scenario to see recommended prompts, pacing, and delivery ideas.

item-1.title: Launch campaigns
item-1.description: Script narrated hero shots, UI flythroughs, and motion graphics for product announcements, ad landers, and crowdfunding pitches.

item-2.title: Teach and onboard
item-2.description: Turn dry documentation into short explainers with chaptered captions, personable hosts, and looping background beds.

item-3.title: Short-form storytelling
item-3.description: Design episodic shorts, behind-the-scenes logs, or quick social edits with consistent characters and pacing.

item-4.title: Virtual hosts and livestream wraps
item-4.description: Stand up AI presenters that greet viewers, summarize events, or tease upcoming broadcasts with energy.

features2.title: Workflow blueprint
features2.subtitle: From idea to shareable video
features2.description: Keep your pipeline simple while the public release is on the way.
features2.supporting: Wan2.5 handles visuals, sound, and tempo so you can stay focused on storytelling.
features2.feature-1: Start with a hook, tone reference, and target channel.
features2.feature-2: Drop in brand assets or hero imagery to keep consistency.
features2.feature-3: Decide between native audio or your uploaded track for each version.
features2.feature-4: Export in platform-ready ratios and archive every render in one library.

features3.title: Why creators choose Wan2.5
features3.subtitle: Built for ambitious storytellers
features3.description: The preview packs the essentials you need for cinematic storytelling without a studio crew.

item-1.title: 1080p clarity
item-1.description: Render crisp footage with natural motion blur and dependable camera moves.

item-2.title: Voices that feel human
item-2.description: Choose from multilingual voices or upload your own narrator for perfect lip-sync.

item-3.title: Prompt extend on demand
item-3.description: Let Wan2.5 refine your script or lock it down for precise messaging per frame.

item-4.title: Fast iteration
item-4.description: Queue fresh takes in minutes and keep multiple creative directions moving.

item-5.title: Brand-safe defaults
item-5.description: Toggle watermarks, control typography, and export compliance notes for reviewers.

item-6.title: Growing ecosystem
item-6.description: Tap into community prompt packs, production checklists, and upcoming API tooling.

api.title: Try the Wan2.5 preview today
api.description: Start with our demos, then step into the community to secure early access.

step-1.title: Watch the launch recap
step-1.description: See the model's audio-visual sync and sample clips in less than five minutes.

step-2.title: Experiment with prompts
step-2.description: Adapt the story starters above, remix voices, and note what resonates with your brand.

step-3.title: Join the creator waitlist
step-3.description: Reserve your spot for the hosted experience and be first in line when the API opens.

step-4.title: Share your use cases
step-4.description: Tell us the industries, volume, and integrations you care about so we can prioritise the right tools.

video.description: Highlights from the official livestream covering audio cues, motion fidelity, and roadmap.

resources.title: Creator resources
resources.description: Bookmark these links to stay ahead of product updates and tutorials.

resource-1.title: Community hub
resource-1.description: Chat with early adopters, share prompts, and see real render examples every day.

resource-3.description: Logos, brand colours, and usage guidelines for press or partners.

insights.title: What to keep in mind while you pilot Wan2.5
insights.description: Tips collected from internal teams, early adopters, and partner studios.

card-1.title: Before you prompt
bullets: Gather 2-3 visual references so the model understands palette and mood.
Write dialogue in the language you need, then mark emphasis with capitalised words.
Plan your CTA overlays ahead of time to leave room for text-safe zones.

card-2.title: During generation
bullets: Queue multiple variations at once to compare motion and vocal energy.
Log revised prompts after each run so you can reuse winning phrasing.
Preview audio through headphones—the mix can shift on mobile speakers.

card-3.title: After delivery
bullets: Trim clips to platform length and add subtitles for accessibility.
Publish both watermark and clean versions to cover teaser and paid usage.
Collect analytics from each channel and feed learnings back into your prompts.

integration2.title: Coming soon to Wan2.5
integration2.description: We are polishing the hosted experience while preparing advanced tooling for launch.
integration2.footnote: Roadmap items may shift based on feedback from the creator waitlist.

item-1.title: Interactive editor
item-1.description: Scrub through frames, adjust scenes, and punch in subtitles without leaving the browser.

item-2.title: Batch storytelling
item-2.description: Upload a prompt pack or spreadsheet to generate series-based content for campaigns.

item-3.title: Creator API and SDK
item-3.description: Automate renders, manage audio uploads, and plug Wan2.5 into your workflow tools.

item-4.title: Brand safety toolkit
item-4.description: Centralise watermark settings, rights management, and review approvals in one dashboard.

pricing.subtitle: Access options
pricing.description: Pick the path that aligns with your production goals and team size.

plan-1.label: For curious creators
plan-1.title: Preview playground
plan-1.description: Small batch renders, curated prompts, and community office hours.
features: Weekly prompt drops and behind-the-scenes breakdowns
Community feedback channel with the Wan2.5 team

plan-2.label: For content teams
plan-2.title: Creator program
plan-2.description: Higher render volumes, collaborative libraries, and priority support.
features: Shared workspaces for brands and agencies
Scheduled exports for social and product launches
Early access to upcoming editing tools

plan-3.label: For studios and enterprises
plan-3.title: Studio partnership
plan-3.description: Custom integrations, governance, and co-marketing opportunities.
features: Dedicated success manager and technical onboarding
Private prompt tuning sessions and strategy workshops
Option to integrate with internal DAM or CMS

notes.title: What to expect next
notes.description: We are working closely with Alibaba Cloud to finalise public pricing.
items: Preview pricing may differ by region once the full API launches.
Early adopters receive migration guidance when tiers go live.
Enterprise pilots can bundle Wan2.5 with other Model Studio services.

item-1.question: How can I try Wan2.5 right now?
item-1.answer: Join the creator waitlist and we will onboard you to the hosted preview with guided prompts and support.

item-2.question: Do the videos include audio?
item-2.answer: Yes. Wan2.5 can auto-generate dialogue, ambience, and music, or you can upload MP3/WAV tracks to keep your brand voice.

item-3.question: What are the current limitations?
item-3.answer: Clips are limited to 10 seconds at 24 fps and the preview focuses on storytelling, not motion transfer or replacement.

item-4.question: Can I publish the videos commercially?
item-4.answer: Yes, but review your region's usage policy and respect any watermark or rights requirements tied to the preview.

item-5.question: Where do I get help?
item-5.answer: Email editors@wan-25.video or ask in the community hub for prompt feedback, roadmap questions, and support.

calltoaction.title: Bring Wan2.5 to your next launch
calltoaction.description: Join thousands of creators shaping the future of AI-native video storytelling.
calltoaction.disclaimer: wan-2.5.video is an independent third-party model service and is not affiliated with Alibaba Cloud or the Wan2.5 official team.

testimonials.title: Loved by early storytellers
testimonials.subtitle: Feedback from the Wan2.5 preview cohort

item-1.name: Lina Zheng
item-1.quote: Wan2.5 let us storyboard a product launch with cinematic motion and native voiceover in a single afternoon.

item-2.name: Marcus Lee
item-2.quote: My team swapped between English and Cantonese voices without re-recording—clients were floored.

item-3.name: Aisha Rahman
item-3.quote: Instructional clips feel alive thanks to Wan2.5's pacing and the way it handles chalkboard text.

item-4.name: Diego Martínez
item-4.quote: The preview nails handheld camera vibes—we cut a social series without touching a physical camera.

item-5.name: Harper Collins
item-5.quote: Prompt extend helps polish scripts while still respecting our brand vocabulary.

item-6.name: Ravi Kulkarni
item-6.quote: We finally have synchronized product shots and narration ready for global rollouts.

item-7.name: Sofia Marin
item-7.quote: Our members share Wan2.5 prompts daily—the iteration speed keeps everyone experimenting.

item-8.name: Noah Walker
item-8.quote: I prototyped a web series pilot with Wan2.5 and locked tone before hiring any talent.

item-9.name: Emily Zhao
item-9.quote: Customer support videos now feel like brand films—audio clarity makes all the difference.

item-10.name: Jonah Briggs
item-10.quote: Batch rendering upcoming campaigns is painless; we treat Wan2.5 as another editor on the team.

item-11.name: Priya Mehta
item-11.quote: Investors saw our Wan2.5 demos and immediately wanted the commercial rights.

item-12.name: Gabe Hudson
item-12.quote: Cinematic camera paths plus native audio gave our AR showcase the polish it needed.
